text: Josephine Garis Cochrane of Shelbyville, Illinois received the first U.S. patent for a commercially successful dishwasher. Dishes fit in compartments in a wheel that turned inside a copper boiler. Her company eventually became KitchenAid.
The first commercial presentation of the famous Lumiere Cinematographe took place at the Salon Indien of the Grand Cafe in Paris. Invited payees got to see ten films.

In Helsinki, Finland Nils and Anna Torvalds gave birth to their son Linus. He would start out dabbling on his grandfather's Commodore Vic-20 and end up developing the open source Linux operating system.
The European Space Agency and the Galileo Joint launched GIOVE-A the first test-bed satellite for the Galileo geo-location system.
